reviews.review_msg: Ryan's field is not Romantic literature - it's Victorian literature, so it was a bit frustrating having an instructor who regularly professed not to have satisfactory answers to questions. In his favour, he is understanding, solicitous, and accessible. My problems are less with him and more with not having an instructor better suited to the course.

She's one of the best professors I had at SFU. She is a tough marker, but she gave every possible help to me in order for me to succeed in my writing. She's wonderful, and the topics were very interesting and gave more perspectives to English literature that I have not thought of.

Although  the subject matter dragged, the class was not bad. She is engaging. Lots of assignments for an upper level English class, with a group project, but easy grader. If you are looking for a prof that'll give you marks for  taking a few risks, here's the one. She's incredibly nice as well.

Best professor ever ! She is super understanding and kind!! She is a tough marker but she is willing to sit and help you!! She gets when you are having a tough day or a tough semester. I was having family and work problems and she was more than generous to me. Questioning if I want to take another class with her but the material is a little dry :/

The people who didn't do well are quite obviously idiots.  She is very helpful, and as long as you do the readings and have some semblance of a human brain (the neanderthals below don't count), you will be fine.  Dr. Forlini is intelligent and charming; I'd highly recommend her.

I attended the first lecture, then dropped her class as soon as I could. Nice person, but disorganized and assumes students have prior experience with class material. She couldn't figure out presentation dates, so students ended up charging for the paper like starving people for a piece of bread. Thought I was in a 3rd yr class - apparently not.

Decent enough - not amazing, but I'd probably take another class with her. Could be pretty boring in her lectures and definitely treated the class like we were 6 year olds who had never taken an English class before. Yes I know who Jane Austen is, yes I know what a metaphor is... Lovely lady just a bit of a pain as a professor. Easy class though.

The 2nd time I've had a class with Michelle--once again, an amazing class! Encourages group work and critical thinking; gives pointers on improvement; allowed revisions of our first essay for extra marks. Very organized, puts a lot of effort into teaching.  Appreciates thoughtful insights based on close readings. Highly recommend! Great prof :)

Levy seems to think she's teaching remedial English -- in a third-year class. She will ask incredibly insulting questions like: "Has anyone heard of the French Revolution?", allows for no moments of intelligence or spontaneity from discussions, and her own insights are vapid and obvious. Don't take -- possibly the worst Prof in the English Dept.
Kind of a hard marker, but overall, quite enjoyed her class. She tries to make things interesting. Very easygoing prof.
